name: Overview
data: [{"id":"835191ba-6ee4-4d80-98ca-6f7239a3d32d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: process_if_main","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2073007e-95b9-4756-ad88-049d38f6f816","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description\n","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"process_if_main","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is a specialized detection utility nested within the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_If","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method. Its sole purpose is to inspect the condition of an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" statement to see if it matches the standard Python idiom ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if __name__ == \"__main__\":","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It analyzes the AST comparison nodes to verify that the variable ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__name__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is being compared against the string literal ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"\"__main__\"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f2cfd0c7-f950-48c8-a488-41d1f3b2503c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters\n","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"In Python, code inside an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if __name__ == \"__main__\":","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" block is only executed when the file is run directly as a script, not when it is imported as a module. For a static analyzer building a dependency graph or API model, this distinction is critical for two reasons:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"01f9cb69-729a-428a-9fb1-05def7324f9b","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scope Pollution:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Variables and functions defined inside this block are typically testing scripts or command-line logic. If the analyzer treats them as part of the module's public interface, it would incorrectly report that these internal test variables are available to other modules that import this file.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"28f56449-16a5-4052-91db-8f9636bc5bb5","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Performance:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Analyzing heavy execution logic (like starting a server or running a test suite) is unnecessary when the tool only needs to understand the module's structural definitions (classes/functions). Skipping this block for non-primary modules saves significant processing time.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"57cbb5bf-4488-4bda-af3f-ad337fda68e3","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6811a1f1-8a90-436a-8ed8-20187633fe28","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"AST Validation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It first checks if the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"if","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" condition is a comparison operation.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"88ae3251-e3ab-4c14-b4c4-25c1a32c18f2","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Pattern Matching:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It checks if the left side of the comparison is the specific identifier ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"__name__","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the right side is the string constant ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"\"__main__\"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a35d2521-c3d3-4461-93b6-518fedbd060e","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Context Check:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It retrieves the current module's namespace. It checks the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to see if the current file is the primary entry point being analyzed or a secondary/library module.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"488e33c9-218f-4de1-acbd-de9ae4fac53b","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Decision:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"True","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" only if the pattern matches and the module is ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"not","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the primary target (implying the analyzer should skip this block).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8bc5e969-f7c6-4407-af79-282cebeb161b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
